sub_title: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.
summary:
10+ years of working experience as a project manager, coastal & river engineer and GIS expert in a broad range of international, integrated and multi-disciplinary water projects. Obtained two Masters’ Degrees at Wageningen University (MSc Geo Information Science and MSc Landscape Architecture and Spatial Planning). 
Passion for improving the quality of our living environment with water as main element. The increasing challenges and pressures by climate change and urban development in the coasts, deltas and rivers domain fascinate and urge to take action for inclusive, sustainable and resilient development.
GIS is one of the main tools to conduct spatial analysis, link numerical models and transform data into self-explanatory visualisations to bring across the core of the message. Connecting and managing people, technology and disciplines through convincing communication, demonstrated by numerous roles in projects as team leader, coordinator and liaison in international teams. Strong at integrating engineering, spatial and socio-economic aspects.
Drive to study and design for implementation of blue and green/ nature based solutions. Creative and gears flexibly between the holistic bigger picture and pragmatic detailing, working in the entire project cycle from conceptualization, design, feasibility, to construction supervision while keeping an eye on required institutional settings.

Specific expertise in:
- River engineering and flood risk assessments (river and floodplain planning, flow modelling, flooding and inundation, statistics)
- Flood resilience and climate change adaptation (vulnerability assessments, spatial and urban planning, resettlement, adaptation, mitigation and protection measures)
- Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and spatial analysis
- Coastal and port engineering (breakwaters, dredging, land reclamation, navigational design)
- IWT Transport (logistics studies, accessibility and navigability)
- Surveys (topography, bathymetry, UAVs, hydrodynamics etc.)
- Technical and economic feasibility, design of measures, cost estimation, assessing benefits and co-benefits

treasury_media.title: Msimbazi Charrette Project, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
treasury_media.description: So proud to have contributed to this very interesting participatory flood resilience and development project as a core team member

education.field_of_study: Geo Information Science and Remote Sensing

projects.title: Lower Msimbazi Upgrading Project, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
projects.description:
Team Leader for the consultancy services for carrying out feasibility studies, preparation of preliminary and detailed engineering designs, cost estimates, bidding documents, and environmental and social due diligence. The project transfers the holistic and integral plan of transforming the flood hazardous area to an iconic city park surrounded by prime real estate forflood resilient urban development into a feasible solution. Preliminary and detailed engineering designs are prepared following a developed flood management strategy with an urban development approach. Interventions included are resettlement of flood prone communities to flood safe terraces constructed from material dredged from the river and river flood plains, bank protections, dredging profiles, urban parks, drainage canals, sediment traps, upgraded urban infrastructure, master planning and urban agriculture patches. Bas van de Sande’s role is Team Leader, responsible for the proper conduct of the entire execution of the assignment.
Client: President's Office Regional Administration and Local Government (World Bank funded)

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: Gelephu Flood Protection Project, Bhutan
projects.description:
Team leader and river engineer of full feasibility study on flood and bank protection and adaptation measures along the Mow River at the Himalayan city of Gelephu, Bhutan, including Delft3D hydrodynamic flood modelling, climate change analysis and full cost-benefit analysis and environmental and social impact assessment.
Client: RVO (D2B Program)
Beneficiary: FEMD, Ministry of Works and Human Settlement

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: RVO DRR (Dutch Risk Reduction) mission coastal protection Kaback, Guinee
projects.description:
Virtual DRR mission to gather and consolidate previous consultancy work done, and to assess the suitability of three project alternatives on a pre-feasibility level for coastal protection and water management of the island of Kaback, namely Alternative 0 (business as usual), Alternative A – Hold the line (development of a solid sea defence on the path of the original protection line) and Alternative B – Managed retreat (using mangroves as primary sea defence in combination with protective infrastructure on land inward located cheniers).
Bas van de Sande’s role was to i) further define and develop the project alternatives, ii) assess the technical feasibility of coastal protection measures including wave study, conceptual structural designs and cost estimations, iii) economic cost-benefit analysis and iv) GIS analysis for all disciplines involved in the mission.

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: Flood Management Feasibility Study for Msimbazi Middle Catchment Area, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
projects.description:
Flood management study on flood and erosion prone middle section of the Msimbazi River, which includes the following activities; i) vulnerability analysis, ii) identification and concept design of mitigation and protection measures and iii) determination of technical and economic pre-feasibility of the measures and alternatives to enhance urban resilience. The process is dictated by a participatory design approach by means of multiple charrettes and includes urban planning expertise. This project complements to the strategy and management framework for the Msimbazi catchment area developed by the World Bank.
Client: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
Bas' role: Project and Team Coordinator, GIS Expert

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: Development Sandbar Breakwater for Dangote Quays Lekki, Nigeria
projects.description:
Full Design (Concept, Tender and Detailed Design) including construction supervision of Sandbar Breakwater to provide calm waters for safe offloading of construction materials. This new type of breakwater, developed by CDR, is based on Building-with-nature principles. The local hydraulic and morphological conditions are being used to form a stable breakwater consisting mostly of sand, rather than rock and concrete.
Client: DORC, Dangote Group
Bas' role: Project Manager & GIS Expert

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: Developing Concept Design Solutions for Coastal Erosion in Bangladesh
projects.description:
This technical assistance targets to support the Government of Bangladesh to develop innovative concept design solutions for future investments in coastal areas of Bangladesh with specific emphasis on coastal erosion to enhance coastal resilience and reduce risk. Acted as a coastal engineer and spatial planner. 
Client: World Bank
Beneficiary: Bangladesh Water Development Board (BWDB)

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: Coastal Vulnerability & Protection Monrovia Metropolitan Area, Monrovia, Liberia
projects.description:
The Government of Liberia (GOL), with the support of the United Nations Development Program (UNDP), is designing a project to protect vulnerable coastal communities and infrastructure in the Monrovia Metropolitan Area (MMA) from the impacts of climate change induced sea level rise (SLR) and related extreme weather events.  CDR has been requested to perform various studies concerning the engineering and safeguards assessment of the proposed Interventions in the coastal areas of the Monrovia Metropolitan Area. Key tasks are performing vulnerability assessments and the development of adaptation options. 
Client: UNDP
Bas' role: Project & Team Coordinator, GIS Expert

contributors.headline: Project manager, Integrated projects and flood resilience at CDR International B.V.

projects.title: Água Grande Coastal Protection Project, São Tomé, São Tomé and Principe
projects.description:
The full feasibility study for coastal protection and road rehabilitation followed a multi-sectoral approach (fisheries, tourism, etc.) and includes a Vulnerability Analysis (climate change, risks), Feasibility Study and Preliminary Environmental and Social Impact Analysis (ESIA). As team/project coordinator and GIS expert worked on all the assessments, coordination with partners and  integrality of overall study.
Client: RVO D2B
Beneficiary: Ministry of Infrastructure, Natural Resources and Environment (MIRNA)

projects.title: MSc Geo Information Science and Remote Sensing Thesis - Sensitivity of Coastal Flood Risk Assessments to Digital Elevation Models, Lagos, Nigeria
projects.description: This study revealed there is an overestimation of the elevation in the global elevation datasets (like SRTM DEM and ASTER GDEM) for the coastal area at Lagos State, Nigeria. This reflects an underestimation of coastal flood risk when the assessment is based on SRTM DEM and ASTER GDEM. The comparison analysis was based on an available high resolution and accuracy LiDAR elevation dataset for entire Lagos State.

projects.description: Internship at Royal Haskoning to apply GIS tooling and solutions to landscape architectural and spatial planning projects.

projects.title: MSc Landscape Architecture & Spatial Planning Thesis - Ponds as Spatial Structuring Components in the City of Khulna, Bangladesh
projects.description:
Thesis subject; "Ponds as Spatial Structuring Components in the City of Khulna, Bangladesh"
This study, based on a desk study and extensive fieldwork, resulted in an integrated plan to preserve the structure of abundant ponds throughout the city of Khulna. Thesis at Wageningen University in collaboration with KU Leuven.
